noun.description: An item of food consisting of two pieces of bread with meat, cheese, or other filling between them, eaten as a light meal.

verb.description: Insert or squeeze (someone or something) between two other people or things, typically in a restricted space or so as to be uncomfortable.
examples: the girl was sandwiched between two burly men in the back of the car

proper noun.description: A town in southeastern Massachusetts, on Cape Cod, a resort with a history of glassmaking; population 20,129 (est. 2008).

origin: Mid 18th century: named after the 4th Earl of Sandwich (1718–92), an English nobleman said to have eaten food in this form so as not to leave the gaming table.
